Detailed Description

template<typename VarRef1, typename VarRef2, typename VarRef3>
struct NotModConstraint< VarRef1, VarRef2, VarRef3 >

constraints;modulo Description The constraint

modulo(x,y,z)

ensures that xy=z i.e. z is the remainder of dividing x by y. constraints;modulo Notes This constraint is only available for positive domains x, y and z. constraints;modulo References help constraints div

virtual triggerCollection NotModConstraint< VarRef1, VarRef2, VarRef3 >::setup_internal (  )  [inline, virtual]

Gets all the triggers a constraint wants to set up.

This function shouldn't do any propagation. That is full_propagate's job.

Definition at line 173 of file constraint_modulo.h.

template<typename VarRef1, typename VarRef2, typename VarRef3>
virtual bool NotModConstraint< VarRef1, VarRef2, VarRef3 >::get_satisfying_assignment ( box< pair< int, DomainInt > > &  assignment  )  [inline, virtual]

Looks for a valid partial assignment to a constraint.

The return value (in the box) is pairs of <varnum, domain value>, where varnum is in the same position as returned by get_vars.

Reimplemented from AbstractConstraint.
